title: Lady Gaga and Ashanti surprise fans as they hijack Brian Newman's jazz set in Las Vegas
text:
It was quite the treat for Brian Newman fans on Saturday night.

Jazz ticket-holders were enjoying a set in Las Vegas from the trumpeter and vocalist before Lady Gaga, 33, surprised the crowd with a few songs.

And if that wasn't enough, Grammy winner Ashanti, 39, who was sitting in the audience enjoying the show, got up to sing a few of her hits with Gaga.

Surprise! Lady Gaga and Ashanti took over Brian Newman's jazz set on Saturday night when they performed some of their songs for his Vegas fans

According to lucky event-goers, the pair belted out two songs including a jazzed up version of Ashanti's first hit, Foolish.

Gaga dressed her 5ft2 frame in a very tiny little black dress that featured a ribbed design throughout.

She teamed the look with fishnet stockings and a pair of her massive platform statement boots.

Hits! According to lucky event-goers, the pair sung two songs including a jazzed up version of Ashanti's first hit, Foolish

LBD! Gaga dressed her 5ft2 frame in a very tiny little black dress that featured a ribbed design throughout

Gaga's platinum blonde hair was pinned back into a stylish up-do and her glam featured a cat-eye and bold red lip.

Ashanti rocked her designer ware with a printed matching Louis Vuitton top and pants combo.

The early 2000s RnB star showcased her true celebrity status with a pair of shades while on stage performing.

Off her face: Gaga's hair was pinned back into a stylish up-do and her glam featured a cat-eye and bold red lip

Designer: Ashanti rocked her designer ware with a printed matching Louis Vuitton top and pants combo

A little too much: And it all appeared to be a little too much for Gaga, sharing a hilarious photo of herself exhausted on her private jet on Sunday morning

Ashanti styled her hair out and sleek and also donned a red lip to complete her look.

And while the Rain on Me singer surprised fans at Brian Newman's concert, she was later surprised herself by Ja Roule while she was performing at the Nightmare on Q Street at the Orleans Arena in Vegas.

The beauty was singing before fellow performer Ja Roule took to the stage with a cake to wish her a happy birthday - despite her turning 39 two weeks ago.

Others performing at the concert included Bone Thugs-N-Harmony, Chingy, MIMS and Baby Bash.

And it all appeared to be a little too much for Gaga, sharing a hilarious photo of herself exhausted on her private jet on Sunday morning.

'11 days in Las Vegas should be illegal,' she hilariously captioned.
description: Lady Gaga and Ashanti took over Brian Newman's jazz set on Saturday night when they performed some of their songs for his Vegas fans.
